cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles W of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across Hispaniola and the Bahamas, then expected to run northward just offshore the east coast of Florida and continue toward the Georgia–South Carolina coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeast Florida Atlantic coast (around Palm Beach County) late Saturday to early Sunday

weather_observation.watch_coast: None at this time (Bahamas only under watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico, U.S./British Virgin Islands, Dominican Republic, northern Haiti coast, Turks and Caicos, and the Central/Southeastern Bahamas under Tropical Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles, Bahamas, Florida peninsula (mainly Atlantic side) and U.S. Southeast coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (15%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; brief gusts possible if the center tracks farther west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat expected for Tampa Bay; only minor tidal rises possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring 1–3 inches of rain with isolated heavier downpours Sunday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Choppy seas in the approaches to Tampa Bay and occasional squalls could disrupt vessel scheduling even without a direct strike.
